sdkExternalBridge.title: External Bridge
sdkExternalBridge.subtitle: Receive requests from browser extensions, CLI tools, and other external clients.

overview.title: Overview
overview.intro: The External Bridge allows external clients to communicate with your HaexVault extension via a secure WebSocket connection. This enables powerful integrations like browser extensions for password autofill, CLI tools for automation, or server-side applications.

useCases.browserDesc: Autofill passwords, sync bookmarks, or access secure notes directly from your browser.
useCases.cliDesc: Automate workflows, manage secrets, or integrate with scripts and CI/CD pipelines.
useCases.serverDesc: Build backend services that securely access your extension's data.

overview.note: External clients must be authorized by the user before they can send requests. All communication is encrypted end-to-end.

howItWorks.title: How it Works
howItWorks.intro: The External Bridge uses a WebSocket-based protocol with public key authentication:

steps.connect: External client connects to HaexVault's WebSocket server
steps.handshake: Client sends handshake with public key, name, and requested extensions
steps.approval: HaexVault shows authorization dialog - user can Allow Once, Allow Always, or Block
steps.request: Authorized clients can send requests targeting a specific extension
steps.autostart: If the extension is not running, HaexVault auto-starts it (minimized) to handle the request
steps.response: Extension processes the request and sends response back to the client

handlingRequests.title: Handling Requests
handlingRequests.intro: Your extension receives external requests through events. You can either listen to all requests or register handlers for specific actions.

connectionStates.title: Connection States
connectionStates.intro: External clients go through several connection states. These are primarily used by client implementations (browser extensions), but understanding them helps when debugging.

authorization.title: Authorization
authorization.intro: Users have full control over which external clients can access their extensions:
authorization.allowOnceDesc: Grants temporary access for the current session. Authorization is cleared when HaexVault restarts.
authorization.allowAlwaysDesc: Permanently authorizes the client. Stored in the database and persists across restarts.
authorization.blockDesc: Permanently blocks the client. The client cannot request authorization again until unblocked in settings.
authorization.warning: Blocked clients can be unblocked in HaexVault's settings. Always inform users if their connection was blocked.
